Package org.opensextant.geodesy

Class UPS

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.geodesy.UPS
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class UPS extends Object implements Serializable
UPS coordinates are based on a family of two Polar Stereographic map projections, one for each pole. The origin of the UPS coordinate system is the pole (north or south), where X=2,000,000m and Y=2,000,000m.

The X-axis lies along the meridians 90°;E and 90°;W. Moving from the pole (north or south), X-values (Eastings) increase along the 90°;E meridian. The Y-axis lies along the meridians 0°; and 180°;. Moving from the north pole, Y-values (Northings) increase along the 180° meridian. Moving from the south pole, Y-values (Northings) increase along the 0° meridian.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • UPS

      public UPS(Ellipsoid ellip, Geodetic2DPoint lonLat)
      This constructor takes an ellipsoid and Geodetic2DPoint object. If WGS 84 is desired, the caller should instead use one of the constructors without the ellipsoid parameter, since WGS 84 is the default. The specified Geodetic2DPoint object (lon-lat point) is converted to its UPS equivalent.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid data model for earth
      lonLat - Geodetic2DPoint coordinates (lon-lat) to be converted to UPS
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if arguments are invalid or out of legal range

    • UPS

      public UPS(Ellipsoid ellip, Longitude lon, Latitude lat)
      This constructor takes an ellipsoid, Longitude and Latitude Objects. If WGS 84 is desired, the caller should instead use one of the constructors without the ellipsoid parameter, since WGS 84 is the default. The specified longitude and latitude object values are converted to their UPS equivalent.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid data model for earth
      lon - Longitude of point to convert to UPS
      lat - Latitude of point to convert to UPS
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if arguments are invalid or out of legal range

    • UPS

      public UPS(Ellipsoid ellip, char hemisphere, double easting, double northing) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This constructor takes an ellipsoid and the UPS parameters for hemisphere, easting, and northing. If WGS 84 is desired, the caller should instead use one of the constructors without the ellipsoid parameter, since WGS 84 is the default. The UPS parameters are converted to their equivalent geodetic (lon-lat) position, along with the correct polar zone.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid data model for earth
      hemisphere - character 'N' for Northern or 'S' for Southern hemisphere
      easting - positive meters east of false adjusted pole
      northing - positive meters north of false adjusted pole
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if arguments are invalid or out of legal range

    • UPS

      public UPS(Geodetic2DPoint lonLat)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for PolarStereographic). The specified Geodetic2DPoint object (lon-lat point) is converted to its UPS equivalent.
      Parameters:
      lonLat - Geodetic2DPoint coordinates (lon-lat) to be converted to UPS
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if arguments are invalid or out of legal range

    • UPS

      public UPS(Longitude lon, Latitude lat)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for PolarStereographic). The specified longitude and latitude object values are converted to their UPS equivalent.
      Parameters:
      lon - Longitude of point to convert to UPS
      lat - Latitude of point to convert to UPS
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if latitude is not close enough to a pole

    • UPS

      public UPS(char hemisphere, double easting, double northing)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for PolarStereographic). The UPS parameters are converted to their equivalent geodetic (lon-lat) position, along with the correct polar zone.
      Parameters:
      hemisphere - character 'N' for Northern or 'S' for Southern hemisphere
      easting - positive meters east of false adjusted central meridian for lonZone
      northing - positive meters north of false adjusted origin (equator for 'N' hemisphere)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if arguments are invalid or out of legal range

  • Method Details

    • validatePolarZone

      public static void validatePolarZone(char polarZone)
      Validate UPS polar zone to see if it is valid (by itself). Used in place of UTM lat band char.
      Parameters:
      polarZone - UPS Polar Zone ('A' or 'B' for Southern, 'Y' or 'Z' for Northern)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if UPS Polar Zone is invalid

    • getEllipsoid

      public Ellipsoid getEllipsoid()
      This accessor method is used to get the currently set Ellipsoid earth model for making projections during conversion to and from geodetic coordinates.
      Returns:
      the currently set Ellipsoid earth model being used by this UPS coordinate

    • getGeodetic

      @NotNull public @NotNull Geodetic2DPoint getGeodetic()
      This accessor method returns the geodetic (lon-lat) point for this UPS coordinate.
      Returns:
      Geodetic2DPoint object (lon-lat) coordinates

      polar zone character ('A' or 'B' for South Pole, 'Y' or 'Z' for North Pole)

      public String toString(int fractDig)
      This method converts the UPS object to a printable string, using the specified number of fractional digits for the easting and northing offsets.
      Parameters:
      fractDig - number of digits past the decimal point for easting and northing
      Returns:
      String formatted UPS coordinate
